Speaker: dascombe

A true leader to remind us of that age.  A righteous leader with the strength of his moral convictions to do what must be done.  I give you that man!  I give you our leader!  Adam Susan!

These appear to be individually weighted flares and we have found traces of the same chemicals at both of the detonation sites which leads us to conclude that, despite a level of sophistication, these devices are all home-made with over the counter chemicals, making them impossible to trace.  Whoever he is, Leader, he's good.

The new day brings good news and bright prospects from overseas, where negotiations with New China are moving in a positive direction. I tell you these things knowing full well that they make you uncomfortable.

Dialogue: Well, I...

The fact that you are here, that you are not rotting in a prison cell, is a mark of my respect and admiration for you, for your craft, and for what you have done for this country.

Speaker: delia
Dialogue: Roses.

Speaker: delia
Dialogue: It's you, isn't it?  You've come to kill me.

Speaker: delia
Dialogue: Oh thank god.  Thank god.

Speaker: finch
Dialogue: Oh my god.

Speaker: finch
Dialogue: Oh bloody hell.

Speaker: dominic
Dialogue: He's killed them all?  It's not possible.

Speaker: finch
Dialogue: Oh no.

Speaker: delia
Dialogue: No, no.  I thought I would be, but I'm not.  I'm --

Speaker: delia
Dialogue: Relieved.

Speaker: delia
Dialogue: Oh god, all these years.  All this waiting.  And somehow I always knew you'd come back.

Speaker: delia
Dialogue: When I saw you that night -- the night you escaped, you were standing against the flames and you looked straight at me.

Speaker: delia
Dialogue: I knew then that one day you'd come looking for me, that you'd find me.

Speaker: delia
Dialogue: What -- what happened at Larkhill. What we did -- What I did.  That terrible knowledge, it's been with me so long.  That I could do things like that.

Speaker: delia
Dialogue: For years, I blamed it on the government, on the authority I could never stand up to.  But living so long with the knowledge of what I did has made me understand otherwise.  I alone was accountable.

Speaker: delia
Dialogue: There is something wrong with us. With all of mankind.  With me. Something evil that made me enjoy what I did.  Some hideous flaw.

Speaker: delia
Dialogue: We deserve to be culled.  We deserve it.

Speaker: rosemary
Dialogue: Derek?  What?

Speaker: derek
Dialogue: Bang.

Speaker: derek
Dialogue: Don't worry, Rose.  I didn't load it.

Speaker: derek
Dialogue: Not tonight.

Speaker: derek
Dialogue: Almond.  What?!  Where?

Speaker: derek
Dialogue: Oh god, yes!  God, thank you!

Speaker: creedy
Dialogue: You look lost.

Speaker: creedy
Dialogue: Can I buy you a drink?

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: No... I made a mistake.

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: I have to find someone.

Speaker: creedy
Dialogue: Well I didn't like the looks of you anyway --

Speaker: creedy
Dialogue: Bloody hell!

Speaker: creedy
Dialogue: It's him!  We got him!

Speaker: delia
Dialogue: It's funny, I was given one of your roses today.  I wasn't sure you were the terrorist until I saw it.

Speaker: delia
Dialogue: What a strange coincidence.  That I should be given it today.

Speaker: delia
Dialogue: Then you are going to kill me now?

Speaker: delia
Dialogue: Is there any pain?

Speaker: delia
Dialogue: Thank you.

Speaker: delia
Dialogue: Can I -- Can I see your face again?

Speaker: delia
Dialogue: It's beautiful...

Speaker: derek
Dialogue: Don't move an inch, you bloody bastard.

Speaker: derek
Dialogue: You didn't hear me arrive, did you? Didn't know we'd rumbled you?

Speaker: derek
Dialogue: It's all finished, chummy.  All of it.  The old man told me it was my head or yours and what do you know. It's yours.

Speaker: derek
Dialogue: Because you're standing over there with your bloody stupid knives and your fancy karate gimmicks --

Speaker: derek
Dialogue: And I've got a gun.

Speaker: derek
Dialogue: Bang.

Speaker: derek
Dialogue: Who -- Who are you?

Speaker: derek
Dialogue: Horrible!  God, it's horrible!

Speaker: finch
Dialogue: Delia?

Speaker: finch
Dialogue: Get an ambulance.

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: Oh no... V?

Speaker: dominic
Dialogue: I'm sorry, sir.  You knew the doctor pretty well?

Speaker: dominic
Dialogue: We found this on her bureau, sir. It's Dr. Surridge's journal.  It covers her years at Larkhill.  It might contain the whole story.

Speaker: prothero
Dialogue: Next.

Speaker: delia
Dialogue: And napalm.

Speaker: finch
Dialogue: That's the last entry until six months later when Dr. Surridge is back in London.  There is no mention of the man in room five again.  End of story.

Speaker: finch
Dialogue: Except that it wasn't the end of the story.

Speaker: finch
Dialogue: Between 2009 and 2012, over forty men and women who were previously stationed at Larkhill met with what were believed to be accidental deaths.  Eventually, only three remained.

Speaker: finch
Dialogue: The three he'd been saving until last.

Speaker: finch
Dialogue: Everyone who worked at Larkhill. Everyone who could have identified him.  You see there are two possible motives here.  Not one.

Speaker: finch
Dialogue: The first is revenge.  He escapes from Larkhill and vows to get even with his tormentors.  The whole exercise an elaborate, chilling vendetta.

Speaker: finch
Dialogue: That's the explanation that I find most reassuring, funnily enough. Because that means he's finished. It's over now.

Speaker: finch
Dialogue: The second motive is more sinister. Like I said, everyone who could have identified him is dead.

Speaker: finch
Dialogue: What if he's just been clearing the ground?

Speaker: finch
Dialogue: What if he's planning something else?

Speaker: finch
Dialogue: You see, the diary we found was in full view.  We didn't have to search for it.  He left it there. He wanted us to find it.  He wanted us to know the story.  Or...

Speaker: finch
Dialogue: For all we know, the diary could be a complete and utter fake. Codename V could have written it himself.

Speaker: finch
Dialogue: He's playing games with us.  He might never have been at Larkhill at all.  Do you see?  It could all be another smoke screen, a false trail, another cover story --

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: Enough!

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: Mr. Finch, would you please explain to me the nature of this meeting?! Because I was under the impression that you had some information about the terrorist, codename V!

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: No more questions, understand!  I want answers!  I am not interested in where he grew up, what kind of flowers he likes or his favorite color!

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: Do I make myself clear?

Speaker: finch
Dialogue: Yes, Leader.

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: Dismissed.  England prevails, Mr. Finch.

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: Mr. Finch, the girl.  Do you have anything on the girl?

Speaker: finch
Dialogue: No, Leader.  Not yet.

Speaker: man
Dialogue: Wake up, cow.

Speaker: guard 1
Dialogue: Tsk.  This pathetic whore is the famous Miss Hammond?

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: You've made a mistake.

Speaker: rossiter
Dialogue: Shut up.

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: Please.  I haven't done anything --

Speaker: rossiter
Dialogue: I said shut your hole!

Speaker: interrogator
Dialogue: Do you know why you're here.  Evey Hammond?

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: No, please, I didn't do anything.

Speaker: interrogator
Dialogue: Allow me to be more precise.  Did you participate in the murder of Dr. Delia Surridge?

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: interrogator
Dialogue: Did you participate in the murder of Derek Almond, director of the Finger?

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: No, I --

Speaker: interrogator
Dialogue: Did you participate in the murder of Bishop Anthony Lilliman?

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: Oh god, I don't --

Speaker: interrogator
Dialogue: Have you ever participated in a terrorist act against your country?

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: No --

Speaker: interrogator
Dialogue: What is the identity of codename V?

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: I don't know.

Speaker: interrogator
Dialogue: You are a lying cunt.

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: They were going to rape me, kill me --

Speaker: rossiter
Dialogue: Shut up.

Speaker: interrogator
Dialogue: This board will not tolerate any more of your lies, Miss Hammond. We have over 120 minutes of audio and videotape and 75 pages of testimonials from eye witness that identify you as an accomplice to the terrorist, codename V.

Speaker: interrogator
Dialogue: Do you want to know why you're here?  You are formally being brought up on charges of murder on fourteen counts and sedition against your Leader and country which brings an automatic sentence of death.

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: Please.  I didn't do anything.

Speaker: interrogator
Dialogue: Process the prisoner and return her to her cell until she is more cooperative.

Speaker: interrogator
Dialogue: Enough.

Speaker: interrogator
Dialogue: Now Miss Hammond, let us review the facts.

Speaker: interrogator
Dialogue: You work for codename V.  Codename V killed Delia Surridge and then Derek Almond with your help and that is why you were found outside her home.

Speaker: interrogator
Dialogue: Isn't that what happened, Miss Hammond?

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: No.  No, that isn't true --

Speaker: interrogator
Dialogue: Oh dear, Rossiter?

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: No, wait!

Speaker: interrogator
Dialogue: "My name is Evey Hammond.  On the 5th of November 2019, I was abducted by the terrorist known as codename V and then taken against my will to an unknown location."

Speaker: interrogator
Dialogue: "Once there, I was systematically brainwashed by means physical and psychological.  I was frequently subjected to sexual abuse during this period."

Speaker: interrogator
Dialogue: "Eventually I was terrorized into helping him commit the murders of Derek Almond, Dr. Delia Surridge, and Anthony Lilliman, Bishop of Westminster."

Speaker: interrogator
Dialogue: "I, the undersigned, swear that the above statement is genuine and that it was not signed by means of intimidation."

Speaker: interrogator
Dialogue: We'd like you to sign that for us, Miss Hammond.  Where we've put the little cross.

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: interrogator
Dialogue: As you wish.

Speaker: interrogator
Dialogue: Escort Miss Hammond back to her cell, Rossiter, where she will wait while you arrange a wet detail of six men.

Speaker: interrogator
Dialogue: Then take her out behind the chemical sheds and shoot her.

Speaker: rossiter
Dialogue: It's time, unless you want to change your mind.

Speaker: rossiter
Dialogue: Sign that statement.  You could be out inside three years.  Perhaps they'd find you a job with the Finger.

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: Thank you but I'd rather die behind the chemical sheds.

Speaker: rossiter
Dialogue: Then there's nothing left to threaten you with, is there?  You are free.

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: You...

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: You did this... to me.

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: You did this to me!

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: You -- You hit me and -- and cut my hair.  It was you.  It was just you all this time.

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: You tortured me.  You tortured me --

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: Oh god, why?

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: Love?

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: Set me free?  Don't you realize?

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: Don't you realize what you did to me?  You nearly drove me mad!

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: I hate you.

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: I hate you!  Set me free?  You put me in a prison to set me free?!

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: Shut up!  I don't want to hear it. I wasn't in a prison.  I was happy! I was happy here --

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: That's warped!  That's evil and it's wrong!  What gives you the right to judge?  Who are you to say what's not good enough?!

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: Shut up!  You're mad!  I don't want to hear it!

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: I can't feel anything!  There's nothing left to feel!  Don't you understand?

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: I don't know what -- Oh god -- I can't breathe --

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: What are you doing to me?  I can't breathe --

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: I feel -- I feel like I'm going to burst.

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: Oh god -- I felt --

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: Like an angel --

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: Oh god, V, I'm so scared.  What's happening to me?

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: The roof?  Outside?

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: I -- I don't want to be blindfolded.

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: Everything's so -- different.

Speaker: dascombe
Dialogue: Finch!

Speaker: dascombe
Dialogue: Do you know what this is all about?

Speaker: finch
Dialogue: No, but I can guess.

Speaker: dascombe
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: finch
Dialogue: "Remember, remember, the fifth of November."

Speaker: dascombe
Dialogue: Oh come on.  He's long gone.  He has to be.  He did what he came to do and it's over.

Speaker: dascombe
Dialogue: Isn't it?

Speaker: finch
Dialogue: Not for us.

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: I have given you almost a year and you have given me nothing. Nothing!

Speaker: dascombe
Dialogue: Now Adam, there is no one better than Finch and you know it.

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: Yes, Mr. Dascombe, I do know it. It is that very fact that keeps me awake at night, wondering if perhaps there is a reason that Mr. Finch has failed.

Speaker: finch
Dialogue: What are you saying?

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: I'm saying that perhaps I don't know you as well as I thought I did.

Speaker: finch
Dialogue: Are you asking for my resignation?

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: No, I am asking for some goddamn results!

Speaker: dascombe
Dialogue: It's not Finch's fault, Adam.

Speaker: conrad
Dialogue: We've all been looking.  The man simply disappeared.

Speaker: etheridge
Dialogue: Vanished.

Speaker: dascombe
Dialogue: He's gone, Adam.  It's over.

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: It's over, is it?  He's gone. Vanished, you say?

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: Transcripts recorded over the last thirty days in which the terrorist was talked about or mentioned in a positive context.  This is only thirty days!

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: Is this what you consider, "disappeared?"

Speaker: dascombe
Dialogue: For god's sake, Adam, it's a stupid variety show.

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: Mr. Creedy, I want the producers, writers, and actors of that "stupid variety show" arrested and charged with sedition.

Speaker: creedy
Dialogue: Yes, sir.

Speaker: dascombe
Dialogue: You can't be serious --

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: Push me, Roger, push me and you'll find out how serious I am.

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: This, this V is still out there.  I can feel him like a sickness worming its way into the hearts and minds of the public.  Something must be done, and done quickly, to exorcise this demon for the very soul of this country is at stake.

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: That is why I am compelled to give each and every one of you notice that if by the fifth of November you are still giving me nothing more than excuses, I will have to revoke your party status and terminate your positions.

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: Mr. Creedy, I will speak with you in private.  The rest of you are dismissed.  England prevails.

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: Mr. Creedy, as the new head of the Finger, you are the most important member of my cabinet.

Speaker: creedy
Dialogue: I, uh, appreciate your faith in me.

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: Your predecessor, Mr. Almond, was a good man, a man who understood what strength in unity meant, a man who, above all, loved his country.  I need to know if you are such a man.

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: Do you love your country, Mr. Creedy?

Speaker: creedy
Dialogue: Oh god, yes!

Speaker: helen
Dialogue: "The most important member of my cabinet."  Yes it is, isn't it, dear?

Speaker: creedy
Dialogue: Oh, don't stop.

Speaker: helen
Dialogue: I stop when you stop.  What did he say next?

Speaker: creedy
Dialogue: I can't --

Speaker: helen
Dialogue: Come on, Peter, what are you afraid of?  Almond used to tell me everything and you're twice the man he was.

Speaker: creedy
Dialogue: He asked me... if I loved my country.

Speaker: helen
Dialogue: Oh yes, I can tell you do love your country, almost as much as you love this...

Speaker: creedy
Dialogue: Oh god...

Speaker: helen
Dialogue: Go on.

Speaker: creedy
Dialogue: Then he asked me to do something... oh, oh...

Speaker: helen
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: creedy
Dialogue: Helen, I can't.  I can't tell you.

Speaker: helen
Dialogue: He told you to frame someone as the terrorist.

Speaker: creedy
Dialogue: My god?!  How did you know that?

Speaker: helen
Dialogue: I know Adam Susan.  Now who was it?

Speaker: creedy
Dialogue: No way.  I can't tell you that.

Speaker: helen
Dialogue: Yes you can, honey.  You can and you will.  You have to trust me, love.  We're going to help each other.

Speaker: creedy
Dialogue: Helen, please.

Speaker: helen
Dialogue: Look at that face.  You see? You're just bursting to tell me.

Speaker: helen
Dialogue: Now who was it?

Speaker: creedy
Dialogue: It was... Fi... Fi... FINCH!

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: That was beautiful.

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: I've wanted to do this for a long time.

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: Thank you, V.  Thank you for everything you've done for me.

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: It was a good backdrop.  I believed it.  I really did.  It's still a bit hard for me to accept that it wasn't real.  That it was just you. Especially the letter.

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: It is a beautiful letter, V.  Every time I read it I could feel Valerie, almost like she was holding me.  I believed in her most of all.  I believed that she loved me and I loved her back.

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: I feel a bit foolish telling you this.  I know that you must have written it and thought you should have it back.

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: Valerie?

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: She's beautiful.

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: Roses.  You grew them for her.

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: They're beautiful.

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: Two days before the first day we met.

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: You're planning something, aren't you, V?

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: What are you going to do?

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: I've never been here before.

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: Oh, V, it's lovely.  Where on earth did you find it?

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: What's in these packages?

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: What are you going to do with all of it?

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: Where does this train go?

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: Whitehall... V, that's the New Government Building.

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: But the underground has been shut down for years.  How are you going to make it run without any power?

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: Yes, Mr. Creedy?

Speaker: creedy
Dialogue: Everything's set, sir.  No worries.

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: When?

Speaker: creedy
Dialogue: Tonight.

Speaker: announcer
Dialogue: Tonight on Tales from the Bible, a story of treachery and betrayal from the Book of Daniel.

Speaker: dascombe
Dialogue: All of London's waiting.  Ready, two.  And here we go --

Speaker: announcer
Dialogue: Tonight, England's greatest hero repels the forces of darkness in a brand new episode.

Speaker: heidi
Dialogue: Oh, Storm.  Save me!  Save me!

Speaker: storm
Dialogue: You mongrel trash, if you harm her!

Speaker: mongrel trash
Dialogue: Look out, de white debil has a laser lugar!

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: Hey, what the -- ?

Speaker: heidi
Dialogue: Oh Storm, hold me.  Hold me tight.

Speaker: finch
Dialogue: I don't know how you stand that tripe.

Speaker: dominic
Dialogue: Es gooh.

Speaker: dominic
Dialogue: Finch?  Finch, what's wrong?

Speaker: dominic
Dialogue: What the hell?

Speaker: finch
Dialogue: Don't you see, Dominic?

Speaker: finch
Dialogue: I'm V.

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: Bloody hell!

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: Freeze!

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: Fuck all.

Speaker: dominic
Dialogue: Creedy?  What the hell's going on?

Speaker: creedy
Dialogue: I'm here to arrest Mr. Finch for acts of treason and terrorism.

Speaker: dominic
Dialogue: You can't be serious.

Speaker: creedy
Dialogue: If I were you, boy, I'd shut my hole unless you want to start explaining why you didn't say nothing about Mr. Finch's secret identity.

Speaker: finch
Dialogue: Why don't you just shoot me, Creedy?  Wouldn't that make everything a lot simpler?

Speaker: creedy
Dialogue: Yeah, I suppose it would.

Speaker: dominic
Dialogue: Holy Christ!  Creedy, you stupid ape!  If Finch is V then tell me who is that?

Speaker: creedy
Dialogue: Bloody fuckin' hell.

Speaker: finch
Dialogue: He has to be at Jordan tower.  Come on!

Speaker: creedy
Dialogue: Don't just stand there!  Follow them!

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: Damn you!  Damn you!

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: Lieutenant, ready my transport.  I want every armed man within a hundred miles at Jordan tower. Now!

Speaker: mother
Dialogue: Hush.  Turn it up.

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: I want this man dead!  I want him shot on sight!

Speaker: captain
Dialogue: Yes, sir.

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: Who was it?  Who was he?

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: Roger Dascombe!  Of course.  Of course!  It makes such perfect sense.

Speaker: captain
Dialogue: Sir, I think there has been a mistake.

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: No!  There is no mistake!

Speaker: captain
Dialogue: But sir, there are people that say they saw both the terrorist and Dascombe together --

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: Who?  Who are these people?  They must be detained immediately. Whatever they saw or whatever they think they saw is subordinate to the truth and that truth is that Roger Dascombe is the terrorist and the terrorist is dead!

Speaker: finch
Dialogue: But I thought I was the terrorist.

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: Finch, what are you doing here?

Speaker: finch
Dialogue: Since I'm not in jail and since you have another, even more convenient suspect.  I'm guessing the charges have been dropped.

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: Be careful, Finch.

Speaker: finch
Dialogue: I am careful, sir.  Always.  That is why I suggest that a search of this building begin immediately.

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: The terrorist is dead!

Speaker: finch
Dialogue: With all due respect, I disagree and I believe that he is presently trying to get out of this building disguised as one of us.

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: Are you challenging my authority?

Speaker: finch
Dialogue: No sir, I'm trying to run an investigation --

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: I am trying to run a country!  When I tell you, Mr. Finch, the terrorist is dead, then the terrorist is dead!  If you continue to suggest otherwise then you will leave me no choice but to have you arrested on charges of sedition. Do I make myself clear?

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: Now, it is imperative for the people of London to know that they are safe, that the terrorist is dead and everything is under control.

Speaker: speakers
Dialogue: The terrorist is dead.  No further threat exists.  Everything is under control.

Speaker: little girl
Dialogue: Bollocks.

Speaker: little girl
Dialogue: Bollocks!

Speaker: little girl
Dialogue: He's not dead!  It's all bollocks!

Speaker: finch
Dialogue: Play it again.

Speaker: dominic
Dialogue: Come on, Finch.  We've seen it fifty times.  I mean, after what they done to you, I don't know why we're even trying to stop him.

Speaker: finch
Dialogue: I don't know.  For twenty seven years, I've been at this job. Twenty seven years, I've done what I've been told to do.  Maybe that's all there is to it.  I'm just a dumb old dog.  A dumb old dog that only knows one trick.

Speaker: dominic
Dialogue: That ain't it, Finch.  It's more than that.  I know you.  It's something personal with this one.

Speaker: finch
Dialogue: Maybe.  And maybe I'm not ready for a revolution.

Speaker: dominic
Dialogue: Well, we got less than thirty hours to stop it.

Speaker: finch
Dialogue: We will.

Speaker: dominic
Dialogue: How?

Speaker: finch
Dialogue: It's on the tape.  I know it.  I can feel it.  He did this for a reason.  He needs something.

Speaker: dominic
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: finch
Dialogue: The line of the Queen?

Speaker: dominic
Dialogue: But what does that mean?

Speaker: finch
Dialogue: Maybe it's a line from Shakespeare. Or a book.  I don't know.

Speaker: finch
Dialogue: But right here.  He's talking to someone.  Someone specific. Someone who knows what he wants.

Speaker: conrad
Dialogue: Helen?  Helen, why did you want that tape?

Speaker: helen
Dialogue: Shut up, Conrad.  I'm thinking.

Speaker: helen
Dialogue: How?  How did you know that?

Speaker: conrad
Dialogue: Know what, my love?

Speaker: helen
Dialogue: All right.  You have a deal.

Speaker: helen
Dialogue: Oh no!  Not you.  Conrad.  Not yet. Here you can have a chocolate. Open up.  Open!

Speaker: helen
Dialogue: Good boy.  As for the rest of the box, perhaps when you're Leader.

Speaker: helen
Dialogue: Right now I need something else Conrad.  I need you to use that pretty little brain for me.  You know all about the old underground, don't you?

Speaker: helen
Dialogue: I need to know everything, understand?  Everything.

Speaker: assistant director
Dialogue: Ready in five, Leader.

Speaker: assistant director
Dialogue: In four, three...

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: Good evening London.  As Leader of this great country, I felt it imperative to speak with you and to assure you once and for all that the shadow that recently fell across our land has indeed passed.

Speaker: woman
Dialogue: Oh, for fuck's sake.

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: What we have endured this long year was no accident, no mere coincidence.  This was not a simple act of terror conducted by a singular madman.  No, this was a test.

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: It was not me, nor the Party, nor the government that was threatened this year.  It was our beliefs. Our faith.  I believe that God himself bore witness to our struggle and like Job I believe that we have been vindicated.

Speaker: drunk
Dialogue: Remember fifth of November!

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: How do I know this?  Let me read to you where I found the answer, where I so often find the answer.  In the Scripture.  Revelations.

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: Oh, V, turn it off, please.

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: What is that, V?

Speaker: creedy
Dialogue: What about Conrad?

Speaker: helen
Dialogue: I told you, I'll handle Conrad and V will take care of Susan.  The mob will take care of the guard and then... You can use the Finger to take over.

Speaker: creedy
Dialogue: Use the Finger?  You mean like this?

Speaker: helen
Dialogue: Oh... oh... that is vulgar...

Speaker: creedy
Dialogue: But you like it?

Speaker: helen
Dialogue: Yes, oh yes, oh you're a pig, Peter...

Speaker: creedy
Dialogue: That I am, misses.  But I'm the pig that's gonna be running this country.

Speaker: helen
Dialogue: Yes and I'm... I'm going to be Eva... Oh Eva...

Speaker: helen
Dialogue: "Don't cry for me Argen... oh Argen... Argen... tina!

Speaker: finch
Dialogue: Eighteen hours.

Speaker: finch
Dialogue: Dominic!

Speaker: finch
Dialogue: Dominic, go home.

Speaker: dominic
Dialogue: But I've still got over three hundred lines from The Fairy Queen.

Speaker: finch
Dialogue: Forget it.  There's no more time. You go home and get some rest. You're going to need it tonight.

Speaker: dominic
Dialogue: He's got us, doesn't he, Finch?

Speaker: finch
Dialogue: Yes, he does.

Speaker: helen
Dialogue: Now listen to me, Conrad.  This is the most important moment of our lives.  Everything I've worked and hoped for comes to this.  Susan is a very dangerous man, especially now, that's why I need you, Conrad. I need you to be stronger than him. I need you to be the better man. Understand?

Speaker: helen
Dialogue: If you do this Conrad, and you do it right, I'm going to turn you from the little man I married into the man of my dreams.

Speaker: conrad
Dialogue: Oh, Helen.

Speaker: helen
Dialogue: Not on the lips.

Speaker: finch
Dialogue: Give it up, old man.  You're not even sure you want to stop him.

Speaker: finch
Dialogue: Christ!  That's it!  It's got to be it!

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: His wife?

Speaker: helen
Dialogue: Leader, I'm terribly sorry but I absolutely must speak with you.

Speaker: helen
Dialogue: I have something to tell you, something important but --

Speaker: helen
Dialogue: I can tell you and only you.  In private.

Speaker: helen
Dialogue: It is a matter of national security.

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: Now what's this all about, Mrs. Heyer?

Speaker: helen
Dialogue: Please, forgive me.  I've been so afraid, afraid to come here to talk to you.  I thought he must know.  I was terrified he knew but I had to come because I knew you were the only one that can protect me.

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: Protect you from what?

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: Come now, Mrs. Heyer.

Speaker: helen
Dialogue: You won't let him hurt me, will you?

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: Let who hurt you?

Speaker: helen
Dialogue: The terrorist.

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: The terrorist is dead.

Speaker: helen
Dialogue: Oh, how I wanted to believe it, Leader, but I know it's not true.

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: How?

Speaker: helen
Dialogue: Because I know who the terrorist is.

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: Who?  Who is it, woman?

Speaker: helen
Dialogue: It's Conrad, Leader.  Conrad.  My husband is the terrorist.

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: What?!

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: How do you know?

Speaker: helen
Dialogue: I saw him, Leader.  In the middle of the night.  I heard something. I went to the landing and that's when I saw it.

Speaker: helen
Dialogue: That mask.  That hideous smiling mask.

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: But how did you know it was Heyer?

Speaker: helen
Dialogue: I know, Leader.  I know the way a woman knows.

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: But you have no proof?

Speaker: helen
Dialogue: Proof?

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: Yes, proof?  This is an extremely delicate situation, Mrs. Heyer.  It has been reported that the terrorist is dead.  It would be a catastrophe to arrest a man now without concrete, conclusive proof. Do you have any evidence at all?

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: But if you're right, if Heyer is indeed the terrorist...

Speaker: helen
Dialogue: Leader!  Wait!

Speaker: conrad
Dialogue: Is everything all right?  Helen?

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: Yes, Mr. Heyer, your wife has done her duty to her country.

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: Don't worry, Mrs. Heyer.  You will be taken care of.  I will launch an immediate investigation and I promise, you will be the first to know when an arrest will be made.

Speaker: conrad
Dialogue: Investigation of what?

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: Subversion, Mr. Heyer.  Your wife was privy to the dialogue of subversives.  That's all you need to know at this time.  Lieutenant!

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: The Heyers are leaving.  I need to see Mr. Creedy at once.

Speaker: helen
Dialogue: Thank you, sir.

Speaker: helen
Dialogue: I want you to go straight to your office and wait for me to call. When I do, I want you to come immediately home.  Understood?

Speaker: conrad
Dialogue: Yes, Helen.

Speaker: helen
Dialogue: Oh, Conrad, I'm so proud of you.

Speaker: conrad
Dialogue: I did it, Helen.  I did it, didn't I?

Speaker: helen
Dialogue: Tonight, Conrad.

Speaker: conrad
Dialogue: Tonight.

Speaker: helen
Dialogue: I promise you will never forget tonight.

Speaker: helen
Dialogue: Goodbye, Conrad.

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: Mr. Heyer!  Mr. Heyer!

Speaker: conrad
Dialogue: Yes?

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: Sir, this package arrived for you, sir.

Speaker: conrad
Dialogue: Thank you.

Speaker: finch
Dialogue: Oh my god.

Speaker: finch
Dialogue: Is the Leader in?

Speaker: lieutenant
Dialogue: Yes, but he's meeting with the Captain of the Guard.

Speaker: finch
Dialogue: Perfect.

Speaker: lieutenant
Dialogue: Mr. Finch, you can't go in --

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: Mr. Finch?

Speaker: finch
Dialogue: Leader, I need as many men the Captain can spare and I need them right now.

Speaker: captain
Dialogue: What for?

Speaker: finch
Dialogue: To capture codename V.

Speaker: finch
Dialogue: He's underground.  The old subway. I know exactly what he's going to do.  If we move quickly, we can be there, waiting for him.

Speaker: finch
Dialogue: Leader, every second we delay...

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: I'm coming with you.

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: Sir --

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: There will be no discussion --

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: But if Mr. Finch is right --

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: I am sick to death of this terrorist being everywhere and nowhere!  I will judge whether Mr. Finch is right and I will judge it with my own eyes!  Do I make myself clear, Captain?

Speaker: captain
Dialogue: Sir, yes, sir!

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: Is there a problem, Mr. Finch?

Speaker: finch
Dialogue: No... no sir.

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: Good.  Captain, mobilize your men.

Speaker: captain
Dialogue: Sir, yes, sir.

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: We'll find this bloody bastard and we will finish him.

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: V?

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: V, what's going to happen?

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: Is it going to be violent?

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: But why?  Why must is be violent?

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: What is the other face, V?

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: Yes, V?

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: Of course.

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: Tell me.

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: It would be my pleasure.

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: All it takes is a little practice.

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: V?  What are you going to do?

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: You're coming back though, aren't you?

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: V, I won't let you leave unless you promise me that you will come back.

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: Just promise.

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: Mark my words, Mr. Finch, this man is going to become an example so that every man, woman, and child in this country will remember what happens to those who would ever think to stand against the state.

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: Captain, I need a gas unit down here with enough nerve gas to fill every rat-hole in these tunnels.

Speaker: finch
Dialogue: I don't think that will be necessary.

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: There are over one hundred of the best trained soldiers in this country down here.  Let him come.

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: Captain, what's happening?

Speaker: captain
Dialogue: They lost him.

Speaker: finch
Dialogue: This... this is a mistake.

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: Don't tell me you're a coward, Mr. Finch.

Speaker: finch
Dialogue: Leader, we have to get out of here!

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: This was your idea.

Speaker: finch
Dialogue: It was a mistake.  This is what he wants.  He knows us, Leader.  He knows us too well.  We have to get out of here before it's too late --

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: What trick is this?

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: This is an outrage!  I order you not to listen to this!

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: Captain, order all your men to fall back and secure this position!

Speaker: captain
Dialogue: Fall back.  Fall back and secure the central platform.

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: Any man that disobeys this order will be court marshaled!

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: Captain!  Captain, where are your men?

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: Goddammit, I will not tolerate this insubordination!  I want those deserters shot, Captain.

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: Shot on sight!

Speaker: captain
Dialogue: You!  You!  Point position.  We're getting out of here!  Now!

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: Traitors!  You cowards!

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: I know who you are!  I'll see you hang!  Every last one of you!

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: Finch?  Finch!  Finch, goddammit, you can't leave me!  Don't leave me!

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: Damn you!  Damn you!

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: Conrad?  Is that you?  You're working with Finch, aren't you? And Creedy!  You're all in this together!

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: Who are you?

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: Noooo!

Speaker: finch
Dialogue: Don't move!

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: Mr. Finch!  Oh god, Mr. Finch!

Speaker: finch
Dialogue: Drop the knife.

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: Oh, I knew it, Mr. Finch.  I knew you wouldn't desert me.  You're a good man, Finch.  A damn good man.

Speaker: finch
Dialogue: No, Mr. Susan.  No, I'm not.  I'm a man who does his job and does what he's told.  For twenty seven years, that's all I've been.

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: Careful, Mr. Finch.  He's quick as the devil.

Speaker: finch
Dialogue: I've read Delia's diary over and over all year.  It sickens me but I am unable to judge her.  I am as guilty as she.

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: Mr. Finch, what are you doing? Shoot him.  Kill the bastard, Finch.

Speaker: finch
Dialogue: I have no excuse.  I did what I was told to do.

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: Finch, I order you to shoot him! Finch!

Speaker: finch
Dialogue: My job was to find you and catch you.  I've done my job.  I've done it for the last time.  I'm tired of it.  I'm tired of it all.

Speaker: finch
Dialogue: Kill him yourself if you can.

Speaker: finch
Dialogue: Thank you, V.  And goodbye.

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: I warned you, Finch, the penalty for treason is death.

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: Are you ready to die?

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: Do you really believe you can pick up that knife before I pull this trigger?

Speaker: helen
Dialogue: Creedy?  Creedy, you dumb bastard, you left your car parked in front.

Speaker: helen
Dialogue: What did I tell you?  Creedy.

Speaker: helen
Dialogue: Oh my god.

Speaker: conrad
Dialogue: Helen...

Speaker: helen
Dialogue: Conrad!  What have you done?

Speaker: conrad
Dialogue: I won, Helen.  I did it.  I won. I'm the better man.

Speaker: conrad
Dialogue: We've been through a bad patch, Helen.  But now, he's gone... There's nothing to come between us...

Speaker: helen
Dialogue: Don't touch me!  You stupid piece of shit!  You've ruined it!  I had it all planned perfectly and you've ruined it!

Speaker: helen
Dialogue: I have to get out of here!  I have to get away!

Speaker: conrad
Dialogue: Helen --

Speaker: helen
Dialogue: No!  Let go!  Now!

Speaker: helen
Dialogue: Conrad, damn you!  Let me go!

Speaker: conrad
Dialogue: No, Helen, you're not leaving me... not this time... not ever.

Speaker: helen
Dialogue: No, please!  Oh god, no!  Oh god, please help me!

Speaker: conrad
Dialogue: No one can help us, Helen.  God is dead.

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: V?

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: You came back.

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: V!  V!

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: Oh god, what happened?

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: You need a doctor.

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: No, don't say that!

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: Yes, they need you, V.

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: I don't understand.

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: I promise.

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: V, you are not going anywhere!

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: You're not going to die, V!

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: I won't let you die!

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: V!

Speaker: sergeant
Dialogue: Return to your homes!  There is nothing to see!  The terrorist is dead!

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: I won't let you die.

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: Goodbye, my love.

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: They will, my love.  They will.

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: I have come here tonight to keep a promise.  A promise that is over four hundred years old.  Tonight I am here to give you your freedom!

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: Since mankind's dawn a handful of oppressors have accepted the responsibility over our lives, responsibility that we should have accepted ourselves.  By doing so, they took our power.  By doing nothing, we gave it away.

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: Tonight, our world will change. Our leaders will be gone and we must choose what comes next.  A return to the chains of others or lives of our own.  A world of the past or one of the future.

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: Let us choose carefully, London, and when we do, let us mark well and remember, remember this fifth of November!

Speaker: evey
Dialogue: Yes, my love.  Yes it is.
